intro: Erigeron galeottii, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along stream banks. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, adding a striking visual element to wetland landscapes. Erigeron galeottii is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
